title: How to Power Two Speakers with a One Channel Amp

steps.title: If you connect the speakers in series, you're adding the speaker impedances together.
steps.content: If you connect the speakers in series, you're adding the speaker impedances together. Example: You have two 4 ohm speakers you want to connect to an amplifier with an output impedance of 8 ohms. For this case, you want to put your speakers in series, so the total impedance of the speakers will be 4+4=8 ohms, matching the amplifier. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Plug the negative terminal (-) of the amplifier into the negative terminal of the first speaker.
steps.content: Plug the negative terminal (-) of the amplifier into the negative terminal of the first speaker.

steps.title: Connect the positive terminal of the first speaker to the negative terminal of the second speaker.
steps.content: Connect the positive terminal of the first speaker to the negative terminal of the second speaker.

steps.title: Connect the positive terminal of the second speaker to the positive terminal of the amplifier.
steps.content: Connect the positive terminal of the second speaker to the positive terminal of the amplifier.

steps.title: For a parallel connection of two speakers, the resulting impedance is half of the impedance of the amplifier (assuming the speakers have the same impedance).
steps.content: For a parallel connection of two speakers, the resulting impedance is half of the impedance of the amplifier (assuming the speakers have the same impedance). Example: You have the same two speakers, but the amplifier has a 4 ohm output. For this case, you want to connect the speakers in parallel because the impedance would be 8/2=4 ohms, again matching the amplifier. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Plug the negative terminal (-) of the amplifier to the negative terminal of speaker 1.
steps.content: Plug the negative terminal (-) of the amplifier to the negative terminal of speaker 1.

steps.title: Hook the negative of speaker 1 to the negative on speaker 2.
steps.content: Hook the negative of speaker 1 to the negative on speaker 2.

steps.title: Plug the positive terminal (+) of the amplifier to the positive terminal of speaker 1.
steps.content: Plug the positive terminal (+) of the amplifier to the positive terminal of speaker 1.

steps.title: Hook the positive of speaker 1 to the positive on speaker 2.
steps.content: Hook the positive of speaker 1 to the positive on speaker 2.
